### createDeadDef() {#acc30e10385342c3caf14a3bf391bc72b}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename ImplT, typename IteratorT, typename CollectionT&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>VNInfo &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LiveInterval.cpp&#125;::CalcLiveRangeUtilBase&lt; ImplT, IteratorT, CollectionT &gt;::createDeadDef (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> Def, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vninfo/#aa750a7f159760b9c378d930deb6a9837">VNInfo::Allocator</a> &#42; VNInfoAllocator, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vninfo">VNInfo</a> &#42; ForVNI)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
A counterpart of LiveRange::createDeadDef: Make sure the range has a value defined at <code>Def</code>.

If <code>ForVNI</code> is null, and there is no value defined at <code>Def</code>, a new value will be allocated using <code>VNInfoAllocator</code>. If <code>ForVNI</code> is null, the return value is the value defined at <code>Def</code>, either a pre-existing one, or the one newly created. If <code>ForVNI</code> is not null, then <code>Def</code> should be the location where <code>ForVNI</code> is defined. If the range does not have a value defined at <code>Def</code>, the value <code>ForVNI</code> will be used instead of allocating a new one. If the range already has a value defined at <code>Def</code>, it must be same as <code>ForVNI</code>. In either case, <code>ForVNI</code> will be the return value.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveinterval-cpp/#l00087">87</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveinterval-cpp">LiveInterval.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### extendSegmentEndTo() {#ae7db5339e5b286123ec7187d5b6d9529}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename ImplT, typename IteratorT, typename CollectionT&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LiveInterval.cpp&#125;::CalcLiveRangeUtilBase&lt; ImplT, IteratorT, CollectionT &gt;::extendSegmentEndTo (<a href="#accfe22239af4a58bae19776418098990">iterator</a> I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> NewEnd)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
This method is used when we want to extend the segment specified by I to end at the specified endpoint.

To do this, we should merge and eliminate all segments that this will overlap with. The iterator is not invalidated.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveinterval-cpp/#l00158">158</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/liveinterval-cpp">LiveInterval.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline"]}>
This method is used when we want to extend the segment specified by I to start at the specified endpoint.

To do this, we should merge and eliminate all segments that this will overlap with.
